intro: Paraboea variopila, commonly known as the variable paraboea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
